traceability.evidence: • bin/dry-aged-deps.js includes config-file support (lines 30–50) with default path '.dry-aged-deps.json', JSON parsing, schema validation (allowed keys, type checks, range checks), merge and precedence logic (CLI > config > defaults). • test/cli.config-file.test.js covers all acceptance scenarios: reading defaults from config, CLI override precedence, invalid JSON exit code/message, unknown keys, value validations, custom config-file name, missing file errors—all tests pass. • README.md documents the .dry-aged-deps.json format (example block under “Example: using a configuration file”) and lists the --config-file option along with all relevant flags. • Existing tests (89 Vitest tests) including E2E, unit, and CLI tests all pass with coverage >80%, confirming optional behavior when config is absent.
traceability.notes: The implementation fulfills all mandatory acceptance criteria: config location, full schema support for thresholds and format, correct precedence, validation with clear errors, optional use, sensible defaults, and documentation. The JSON schema file is not present but was only a non‐mandatory recommendation.
